intro: Prescottia pachyrhiza, commonly known as the Mexican bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped blue or violet flowers. The plant has a tuberous root system and is typically found in rocky or limestone soils. It thrives in full sun and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
